SENT.plain: A 67-year-old man presented four recurrent, alternating facial palsies, two right abducens palsies and eventually a right extrinsic third nerve palsy due to brain-stem infarction in a 37-year time-span
Neuroradiological examinations showed hydrocephalus and an elongated, tortuous, ectasic basilar artery
This patient presented in his lifetime the whole clinical spectrum of the dolichoectasic basilar artery complications
